comments.body:
I wouldn't say endermen have villages or pigmen have nether fortresses.  Zombies have zombie villages, although I've never found one.  Nether fortresses are more for the wither skeletons and blazes, as those are the mobs that only spawn there.  End cities are more populated by shulkers than endermen.

I'm not against more special structures, but to just say that all hostile mobs need a special structure is a bit much.
yesss your soo on the right track we should have scary features added to make minecraft interesting.
I wonder what blacksmith will have in there chests! Maybe netherite
I think netherite is to op for the chests, maybe ancient debris?

Blacksmiths would have ancient debris, gold, etc. Netherite ingots for 1,152 gold nuggets (128 gold ingots) each, iron tools for an 9 nuggets each, and golden tools for 27 nuggets each.

Maybe have the houses built from red nether brick instead of polished quartz.

Can you add amythest (cant spell) armor and weapons to the second  half of the update please? Can you also add a volcano biome but not too detailed or big either... Also can you adda sea boss called the terror leviathan that drops a budding amythest block with a spyglass on a cross bow please. Although i am asking a lot but i am asking this for my 1 year ols sister?
Great idea üí°üòâüòéüòÅ

Yes plz
I also suggest adding gold or quartz golems to the villages.Otherwise good idea
Maybe overworld biomes would get custom colors when viewed from the Nether dimension as well. Even if it was just Nether biomes I‚Äôd still like this either way
And maybe a way to ensure when you create a Nether Portal in the overworld, the portal will be created in a specific nether biome.

Good idea, but I think that the color of portal should correspond to the backround color, so grey for basalt deltas, purple (or pink) for warped forest, red for crimson forest, light blue for Soul Sand Valley, and desaturated red for nether wastes. I can definitely understand how this would be a good idea though. For example: if you lit a nether portal and it was light blue, you would have an early warning, and would probably choose to build your portal somewhere else.

To add to the idea, maybe you could dye the portal to override the colour, so if you wanting a red portal that opens to a basalt delta, you can do that. And you break the portal and relight to reset it.
Deserts already have villages, desert wells, and desert temples. I'd much prefer Mojang add structures to biomes that don't have many yet, like snowy biomes, perhaps. No support, sorry.
I agree with macchuPicchu, plus you didn't really describe what you thought a "big castle" would entail...

Heh! Great idea! But, this will need more details in order for the Minecraft Team to understand and this to be added. Please stop hating on people‚Äôs ideas even though they have not much detail. ‚ÄúA large sandstone castle with dungeons under the sand. Husks and creepers would spawn. Chests full of loot will fill each chest. Far away from the spawn point.‚Äù That‚Äôs what I was thinking of. But, great idea! I like it!

StarKittychu, telling someone that their idea needs improvement isn't "hating" on them. Some ideas are simply not good at all, and it's okay to say so as long as you can explain why.

This is not a great idea because there are other biomes that could benefit much more from new structures than deserts would. And your idea is basically a cross between a desert temple and a spawner dungeon, which are both things we already have, so it doesn't appear to add much to the game, either. Sorry to be honest.

I know MacchuPicchu, Just, sometimes when people get feedback, it might sound a bit mean to them. They might take it too seriously. I just what them to know that I don't mean to sound mean if they think I sound mean. (So many means.)
And, MacchuPicchu, you say it isn't good, than that's your opinion. I think its ok. but there is kinda already "castles" in Minecraft...

This sounds like the perfect thing to be added into Minecraft. But maybe these boats you should be able to sail, and maybe a bit of waves during thunderstorms so that could explain why/how the boats crashed. I voted for this idea.
This is a good idea. Minecraft should start making VILLAGERS higher intelligence than animals - even a creeper has more brains!
Also good idea Runway

The devs decided not to put rubies in the game because one of them is red color blind.

And, I doubt they'd like to make Netherite obsolete after just adding it.

I personally think that the netherite armor is more than enough as having better tiers of armor can imbalance the game. Also this ruby thing is so wanted by everyone so it's just a matter of time until it gets added to the game.
Oof, defensive. Well, might want to look at those arguments again.

A use for Rubies (2/2)

so in my opinion there should be rubies in the shipwreck loots, in the pillagers outpost loots, in the woodland mansion loots and also in the underwater ruins loots (so players would explode more), maybe even in the archaeological sites, there we could find both rubies and emeralds, to explain the transition from rubies to emeralds (from the sea to the surface of the earth, perhaps creating a story of how they once used rubies for traiding and now use emeralds for traiding). Rubies would be really rare (also because it would be difficult to mine them from under the sea), I think that inside the ocean monument instead of gold there must be blocks of rubies, to make the loot more important, also because now we find a lot of gold in the nether ! And illagers would drop rubies instead of emeralds. In short, like the illagers who are the out cast of the villagers, the rubies would also be the out cast of the emeralds. Adding rubies to minecraft would be really cool especially for veterans of the game! (illagers should have red eyes, like villagers have green eyes)
Maybe it should not just be found in the end, but it is more common in the end.

I think it should only be found in the end, if it isn‚Äôt then it just makes netherite completely obsolete. Also, it should only be in the end islands so players can only get it after beating the game and they can‚Äôt use it for the end fight.

they should be used for magic items like staffs

we already have a bunch of tiers or armor and netherite just got added

rubies should spawn in the overword also
You got my vote

and please can it be in the overworld?
ok ruby could be found in overworld as well, but it's only a 1 out of 50% chance. and in the end it's a 5 out of 50% chance, and in end islands it's a 15 out of 50% chance, (if ok).

The reason that I was so against having rubies only in the end, is because I have a personal opinion about having all real-life ores/gems that get added being able to be found in the overworld, but it is still a good idea to have some kind of ore in the end, and I love all the other ideas about the end. Great post!
Good idea but just crimson villages and netherwaste villages i think it would be better.

Your ideas creative but i don't get the point, we have bastions think of a bastion as a giant village in one big piglin head shaped structure, and the golden golem isn't needed at all, piglins can protect themselves just fine, especially now that piglin brutes exist. and honestly there could just be raids for bastions, maybe with wither skeletons, since wither skeletons and piglins don't like each other.

i disagree with Your ideas creative but i don't get the point, we have bastions think of a bastion as a giant village in one big piglin head shaped structure, and the golden golem isn't needed at all, piglins can protect themselves just fine, especially now that piglin brutes exist. and honestly there could just be raids for bastions, maybe with wither skeletons, since wither skeletons and piglins don't like each other. i think its a really good idea but i was thinking more of a black and orange lava golem that can set enimies on fire
Or, just spitballin', three iron golems immediately spawn in during a raid to protect the villagers. (Only issue is this would make a faster iron farm.)
How about abandoned (Zombie) Villages have 50/50 chance of either fully being occupied by villagers or by Zombies and Zombie villagers which always have helmets

They should not only be bigger, but be decorated too in unique colors and designs. Like add plants in flowers pots, paintings, bookshelves, a kitchen/dining room, bedrooms, weapons on item frames, ect.
I love this idea! Villager houses are SUPER crammed.
that would be really cool and also that would make caves more fun to explore
A jelly portal to jellys house

I suggested something similar, and was told there were already topics about it.  It took until now for me to find this.

My suggestion is that the portal be composed of composite blocks (bone, quartz, coal, iron, redstone, lapis lazuli, gold, emerald, diamond, or netherite).  Attached to the portal structure would be a new block called a keystone.  The keystone could be formed from ender pearls, netherite ingots, and diamonds to make it difficult to make.  The keystone is used as part of the portal frame (or maybe outside of it like the gold blocks on ruined nether portals?)  When a second portal of the same material is created, the portals connect to one another in a manner similar to nether portals (or perhaps only after special splash potion is used on it?).  This way each block type could create a different portal link.

I would suggest that the interior portal dimensions range from 1x2 (door sized) to 21x21 (maximum nether portal size), and that each portal material creates a different color visual effect.

To get even more portal connections, it could be that only portals with identical interior dimensions as well as construction material connect to one another.
Portal would be a faster way travel
Is a good idea!!
good idea
The portals could be linked to a certain (XYZ) coordinates just like a command block.

i disagree with the xyz idea, because then players could be incredibly op and maybe even make their base at two corners of the world. that would mean they have 3 sides (including the floor) that are impenetrable. no, dont do this, its too OP. (imo btw)
Maybe the portals could work somehow like in Valheim (named portals with only 2 ends available for each name)

This is an interesting idea, but there aren't any cities in the game, existing or ruined, that would fit with an abandoned sewer.  The villages are far too small to have sewers large enough to walk in.
@ClayGoddessSari Maybe it would connect to a cool new structure "Abandoned City" which is a big ruined village, surrounded by a stone brick wall.

In the case of Villages, the sewers could just follow the same shape as the paths above. I don't think polished blocks should be used since it's supposed to look abandoned. Maybe it could just be made of cobblestone and moss stone? Unfortunately, there's no way for the structure to end specifically next to a river, but the structure could be built in such a way that wherever it does exit, it would have water flowing out.

I doubt that Mojang would implement rats and bats as hostile mobs. Maybe just regular bats for ambience along with Giant Rats that could be neutral? Or even Drowned could spawn in the sewers and their design would suit the environment well!

Now for poison water, it's tricky to come up with new fluids that work because they have to be able to interact with water and lava in some way. So maybe when poison water comes into contact with regular water, it becomes regular water, like it's being diluted. And since poison water is just a form of water, it would act as such in contact with lava, forming obsidian, stone, or cobblestone, depending on how they touch.

yeah I think that should beblow back up

Some might need updated visuals and I think some could use unique mobs as well as items. Maybe you could find a poison enchantment for the bow from the jungle temple or pieces of a magical fire weapon from Nether fortresses!

Well that's just it. Crying Obsidian isn't that rare. Atleast, that's what I think. Crying Obsidian can only be obtained by bartering with Piglins (new mob) and I'm pretty sure it is a 1 out of 3 chance.

I like this idea, in the current world I'm playing in I found a great spot in the overworld, but the corresponding nether is very boring. Even if the crying obsidian is not that rare it could make for an interesting addition to game having the possibility to travel very far away.

 

Even with the 1.16 nether additions, if your base corresponds to a boring place such as a wasteland with the only neighbour being a basalt delta without bastions, the nether becomes very boring and forces you to go over the top of the nether to move around

This wouldn't make much sense since 1 block in the nether = 8, then suddenly changing it to 16 would mean that the entire nether would need to be restructured, although would be neat to see a new dimension...

Well, the idea was for people who need to get up on top of the Nether Roof. For grinders, exp and tree farms, etc. It‚Äôs a large expanse that is used by many for alternate purposes. My idea is that there should be a non-glitched way to get up there that doesn‚Äôt involve breaking bedrock.
